content.description: A researcher in sports medicine is interested in comparing the amount of daily screen time between high school students who are athletes and high school students who are not athletes. A random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> high school students who are athletes and a random sample of <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> high school students who are not athletes will be selected. Each student will be asked “Do you typically have more than <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours of screen time each day?”
content.question: Which of the following is the most appropriate test for the researcher to use to investigate whether there is a difference in the amounts of daily screen time?

choices.label: A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population means
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population means

content.answer: A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population proportions

topic.text: 6.10: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
